meanings.definition: The turning or bending of a plant or other organism in response to touch or contact with a solid object.
meanings.sent1: The thigmotropisms of the vine allowed it to wrap around the fence for support.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study thigmotropisms to understand how plants respond to their environment.
meanings.sent3: The thigmotropisms of the tree made it seem like it was giving a friendly hug to the nearby rock.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity about thigmotropisms led her to compare plants to dancers gracefully twirling around obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The textbook vividly described thigmotropisms as the plant's way of feeling its way through the world.

meanings.definition: The growth response of a plant or other organism to physical contact with a solid object.
meanings.sent1: We observed the thigmotropisms of the bean plant as it reached out to touch the trellis.
meanings.sent2: Gardening enthusiasts often witness thigmotropisms in climbing plants like ivy.
meanings.sent3: The thigmotropisms of the flower made it seem like it was trying to high-five the garden gnome.
meanings.sent4: In her poem, she likened thigmotropisms to nature's gentle handshake with the world.
meanings.sent5: The documentary showcased thigmotropisms in a mesmerizing sequence of plants bending towards the light.
